revised_title: The Efficiency and Survival Value of Modes of Dispersal in Plants
tldr: The author discusses the efficiency and survival value of different modes of plant dispersal, such as wind, water, and animal-assisted dispersal. Wind dispersal is found to be the most wasteful, while animal-assisted dispersal is more selective and efficient. The author also highlights the importance of considering the reproductive capacity and habitat requirements of a species when evaluating the effectiveness of dispersal methods.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Environmental Science
